numlitem.para: Associated pack is operated in STBY WARM,
Flow control valve in associated pack is verified to be operative,
Associated pack is turned OFF at TAT above 0ºC.
Operate the associated pack in STBY W mode when TAT is below 0°C.
Operate the associated pack OFF when TAT is above 0°C.

note.para: With the pack OFF for takeoff, a bleed OFF light may illuminate during takeoff power application. As engine power is reduced, the PRSOV regulating feature will open slightly and the BLEED OFF light should extinguish.
If the other pack (the pack with the operative ACM) fails, the associated pack may be turned OFF below 10,000 feet, if necessary, to control cabin temperature.

placard.para: Placard affected Pack Selector "L (R) ACM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Verify affected Flow Control valve operation.

numlitem.para: Select Left and Right Engine Bleed Air to OFF. Make sure amber OFF lights are ON.
Make sure CARGO FIRE switch lights are in OFF position.
Make sure flaps are fully retracted.
Select the operational pack to AUTO, and the affected pack to STBY W. Make sure PACK OFF lights go off.
Access ANALOG DISCR page 1/2 on FMC CDU to view ECS PACK H/L indication. Make sure L and R ECS PACK H/L entries indicate HI.
Access affected Pack Flow Control valve visual indicator and take note of valve position.
Select the unaffected pack to OFF.
Access ANALOG DISCR page 1/2 on FMC CDU to view ECS PACK H/L indication. Make sure the running ECS PACK entry indicates HI.
Access affected Pack Flow Control valve visual indicator and make sure visual indicator moves CCW towards OPEN (HIGH FLOW).
